{"step_by_step_thinking": "Cohesin is a protein complex that regulates the separation of sister chromatids during cell division. Recent studies have shown that cohesin and its regulatory proteins play a role in controlling gene expression, which can influence cell differentiation. Specifically, research has indicated that cohesin is involved in the regulation of myeloid differentiation, which is a process that leads to the formation of different types of white blood cells.", "answer_choice": "A. yes"}
